AutoColorCorrelogram.ExtractionMethod - Enum in net.semanticmetadata.lire.imageanalysis
Defines which algorithm to use to extract the features vector
AutoColorCorrelogram.Mode - Enum in net.semanticmetadata.lire.imageanalysis
Defines the available analysis modes: Superfast uses the approach described in the paper, Quarterneighbourhood investigates the pixels in down and to the right of the respective pixel and FullNeighbourhood investigates the whole lot of pixels within maximumDistance of the respective pixel.

downsample(FloatArray2D, FloatArray2D) - Static method in class net.semanticmetadata.lire.imageanalysis.sift.FloatArray2DScaleOctave
downsample src by simply using every second pixel into dst

For efficiency reasons, the dimensions of dst are not checked, that is, you have to take care, that dst.width == src.width / 2 + src.width % 2 && dst.height == src.height / 2 + src.height % 2 .

FloatArray2DScaleOctave - Class in net.semanticmetadata.lire.imageanalysis.sift
single octave of a discrete FloatArray2DScaleSpace

This class is optimized for the Difference Of Gaussian detector used in David Lowe's SIFT-algorithm \citep{Loew04}.

LocalitySensitiveHashing - Class in net.semanticmetadata.lire.indexing.hashing
Each feature vector v with dimension d gets k hashes from a hash bundle h(v) = (h^1(v), h^2(v), ..., h^k(v)) with h^i(v) = (a^i*v + b^i)/w (rounded down), with a^i from R^d and b^i in [0,w)
If m of the k hashes match, then we assume that the feature vectors belong to similar images.
LocalitySensitiveHashing() - Constructor for class net.semanticmetadata.lire.indexing.hashing.LocalitySensitiveHashing

upsample(FloatArray2D, FloatArray2D) - Static method in class net.semanticmetadata.lire.imageanalysis.sift.FloatArray2DScaleOctave
upsample src by linearly interpolating into dst

For efficiency reasons, the dimensions of dst are not checked, that is, you have to take care, that src.width == dst.width / 2 + dst.width % 2 && src.height == dst.height / 2 + dst.height % 2 .
